text.sentence: Consumer | U.S. Food and Drug Retailing four March two thousand sixteen
FYsixteen is turning out to be a year of unusual events for COST.
First, it is raising wages for its entry level workers for the first time in nine years.
It is also implementing its annual increase for the highest paid workers, who represent a good portion of the store employee base.
Combined, the wage increases will pressure EPS by dollar .three this year.
Second, COST continues to implement additional modules of its new technology platform, so that depreciation will reach its peak in two thousand sixteen and two thousand seventeen.
There will also be some additional implementation expenses for the new syste Miss This pressured twoQsixteen EPS by dollar .one.
Third, the company will open a larger number of stores ­ thirty ­ than it has for a long time .
In two thousand fifteen, the company opened only twenty three stores, fewer than it had originally expected.
Fourth, it is shifting its COST branded credit card to Visa from American Express.
Once it is fully implemented, most likely in June, expenses will go down, and the company expects that it will give most of the savings back to members, further boosting the value it offers.
For now, it is probably a slight negative to sales as it gets less marketing assistance from American Express.
Finally, the multi quarter benefit to margins from declining fuel prices is likely to start moderating pretty soon.
We expect fuel margins to return to more normal levels soon, so one could say the unusual event was when the margins were so wide.

Compounding these expense pressures are the continuing negative effect of FX on COST's reported sales as earnings, which in twoQsixteen led to sales growth of only two.six percent and an EPS decline of one percent .
Putting all these factors together causes us to lower our EPS for the remainder of FYsixteen and FY seventeen.
Consequently, we are maintaining our Equal Weight rating and dollar one hundred sixty price target based on twenty sevenx FY seventeenE EPS of dollar five.ninety five.

Costco continues to operate some of the most productive stores across all of retail and we expect the company to continue to expand its store base.
However, the company currently trades at a premium to many of its peers, as well as its historical valuation.
Upside to comps from already strong trends could result in further SG and A leverage and increase profitability.
Also the company's gross margin could benefit from continued strong fuel margins.
dollar one hundred seventy reflects twenty eightx our upside FY seventeen EPS of dollar six.seven.
Any disruption to membership renewals, greater FX headwinds, or deflation could hurt profitability.
dollar one hundred forty five reflects twenty fivex our downside FY seventeen EPS of dollar five.seventy seven.

percent estimate, with SG and A as a percentage of thirty four bp net sales increasing thirty four bp, to ten.twenty eight percent, twenty six bp higher than our forecast.

We, Meredith Adler, CFA and Matthew McClintock, CPA, CFA, hereby certify that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect our personal views about any or all of the subject securities or issuers referred to in this research report and no part of our compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.

To the extent that any of the conclusions are based on a quantitative model, Barclays hereby certifies that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect the firm's quantitative research model and no part of the firm's compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.
Barclays Research is a part of the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC and its affiliates .

dot com or call two hundred twelve thousand five hundred twenty six one thousand seventy two.

The analysts responsible for preparing this research report have received compensation based upon various factors including the firm's total revenues, a portion of which is generated by investment banking activities.

Analysts regularly conduct site visits to view the material operations of covered companies, but Barclays policy prohibits them from accepting payment or reimbursement by any covered company of their travel expenses for such visits.
In order to access Barclays Statement regarding Research Dissemination Policies and Procedures, please refer to http://publicresearch.barcap
In order to access Barclays Research Conflict Management Policy Statement, please refer to: http://publicresearch.barcap
The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Food and Drug Retailing Big Lots, Inc. Dollar General Corporation GNC Holdings Inc. Performance Food Group Co. Sprouts Farmers Market, Inc.
United Natural Foods, Inc. Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has one thousand eight hundred seventy four companies under coverage.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: Our earnings forecast and investment thesis for Costco are subject to domestic and international risks including cost of goods, consumer spending and debt levels, currency fluctuations, interest rate fluctuations, store expansion plans, variability in comparable store sales, and market saturation.
